title: Inquiry-Based Instructional Design Program to Foster Critical Thinking and Learning Engagement

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary science fundamentals and job-related scientific problem-solving experience
context.additional_context: A course for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields to strengthen scientific problem-solving competencies through inquiry-based pedagogy. Blended learning environments utilizing personal devices (BYOD). Integration of project-based assessment and motivational strategies

learning_goals: Learners actively engage in scientific problem-solving processes with over 80% participation in inquiry-based instructional design environments.
Learners derive solutions by applying at least three critical thinking strategies (e.g., hypothesis testing, data analysis, logical evaluation) in open-ended scientific problem scenarios.
Learners maintain learning satisfaction above 4.0/5.0 in instructional design environments incorporating motivational elements (e.g., self-directed goal setting, feedback utilization).

resources: Science Experiment Kit and Simulation Software

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
